title: 41+ Best Racing Fonts for High Speed Designs
description: Are you looking for the best racing fonts? Buckle up, as we share our top picks below. Racing fonts play a crucial role in automotive design and branding. From car ... Read more
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Do you want to add a touch of speed and power to your designs? These best racing fonts will help you do that. These bold and powerful characters will make your designs more eye-catching.
text: Are you looking for the best racing fonts? Buckle up, as we share our top picks below. Racing fonts play a crucial role in automotive design and branding. From car logos to advertising campaigns, the right font can communicate the essence of a brand or model. Choosing the perfect font can be a daunting task, but we’ve got you covered with our list of the best racing fonts available today. We’ve included a range of options, from classic and elegant to modern and bold, so you can find the perfect fit for your project. Whether you’re designing a racing logo, creating a futuristic design, or simply want to add a touch of automotive flair, these fonts will take your work to the next level. Our list includes both free and paid options, so you can choose based on your budget and needs – whether for commercial projects or personal use. We’ve thoroughly reviewed and tested each font, considering factors like readability, style, and versatility. With the right car racing font, you can evoke a particular vehicle or brand’s speed, power, and personality. So strap in and get ready to explore our top picks for the best racing fonts out there. Also see our compilation of the best car logos, best adventure Fonts, and best aggressive fonts. UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Racing Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 41+ Best Racing Fonts for High Speed Designs 1. TORQUE MASTER Torque Master, Image Credit: Envato Elements TORQUE MASTER is the ultimate font choice for adding a burst of racing energy to any design project. As professional creatives, we’re huge fans of the strong, sharp corners and the cutout on the inner, along with the bold italic uppercase and regular lowercase letters that create the perfect balance. We’ve personally used TORQUE MASTER for online games, posters, social media covers, and more, and it never fails to impress. While it may not be suited for all design needs, if you’re looking to emphasize a high-energy theme, TORQUE MASTER is our perfect choice for you. We highly recommend this font for an extra boost to any design project. 2. Speed Demon Speed Demon, Image Credit: Envato Elements Speed Demon is the font that every designer needs to capture the essence of car racing. As professional creatives, we’re in love with its sleek, modern design that perfectly conveys the boldness and power of the sport. With sharp angles and dynamic lines, it’s ideal for any high-impact design that requires attention-grabbing typography. We’ve used Speed Demon for various projects, from posters for racing events to marketing materials for sports brands, and it always delivers a sense of excitement and urgency. Its versatility and adaptability make it easy to read at any size, and its racing-inspired style adds the perfect touch of speed and thrill. Overall, we highly recommend Speed Demon for anyone looking to make a bold statement with their designs. 3. MONOCOQUE Car Racing Game Font Monocoque, Image Credit: Envato Elements Looking to add some racing spirit to your designs? MONOCOQUE is the perfect choice! Its blocky shape, sharp corners, and cut-out interior motifs add a powerful and strong edge to any project. As professional creatives , we’ve used MONOCOQUE in various projects like online games, movie titles, fast food menus, and social media page covers. We were thoroughly impressed by its unique style and ability to catch the viewer’s eye. Whether you’re a designer or marketer, MONOCOQUE’s bold design is sure to make your projects stand out from the crowd. Though it is one of the best racing fonts, it can also be used by brands promoting a high-performance product. It’s definitely worth considering for anyone looking to add some edge to their designs! 4. Chasis7 Chasis7, Image credit: Envato Elements For us graphic designers, we can confidently say that Chasis7 is a font designed with automotive enthusiasts in mind. Its sharp, angular lines and high-tech feel convey speed, power, and precision, making it the perfect choice for racing games and posters for car shows. We love how it instantly captures attention and transforms designs into dynamic visuals. However, we found that MONOCOQUE may not be suitable for more formal or conservative projects, and its bold design could potentially overwhelm certain presentations. But if you’re looking for an alternative font that conveys a similar feeling of speed and power but with a more versatile and classic look, you might want to check out Piston Race . Overall, we suggest this as one of the best racing fonts to create eye-catching designs related to the world of racing. Chasis7 is worth checking out. 5. Stooges Races Stooges Races, Image credit: Envato Elements Stooges Races is a fantastic typeface that transports your designs back in time. As professional creatives, we love its hand-drawn style, which draws inspiration from vintage motorcycle posters from the early 1900s. It’s perfect for logos, games, and graphics related to racing, automotive, Detroit, and classic machines. We’ve used Stooges Races in our designs, and they always add a unique and retro charm that captures the essence of the era. It’s the perfect choice for designing in the 1940s, 1950s, or 1960s, and adds a perfect touch of vintage flair to any project. Overall, we highly recommend Stooges Races for anyone looking to add a touch of old-school character to their designs. Get ready to stand out with this fantastic typeface! 6. Dingbat Car Transport Provider Car Service Dingbat, Image credit: Envato Elements We had the pleasure of trying out the Dingbat Car Transport Provider font , and we must say, we were impressed! This versatile font contains 62 symbols that are perfect for various projects, logos, and ornaments. We loved how easy it was to use, with TTF, OTF, and EOT file formats, as well as Unicode compatibility. We found the basic Latin characters clear and easy to read, making this font a great addition to any designer’s toolbox. Overall, we highly recommend the Simple Car Service dingbat font for anyone looking for a unique and useful design element. 7. Fastrun Fastrun, Image Credit: Envato Elements Fastrun is a font that exudes strength and power. We were absolutely delighted by this font for its bold and authentic display, making it the perfect choice for car racing-related designs. We were impressed by the font’s versatility, which allows it to be used in nearly any design that requires strong characters. Our experience with Fastrun was fantastic, and we enjoyed the availability of alternate characters, ligatures, and multilingual support, making it to our list of best racing fonts. What we didn’t like is the font’s bold and strong character a bit overpowering for certain design projects that require a more subtle and delicate touch. To compensate for that, you may try Custody Script. The regular, italic, italic outline, and outline versions offer a wide range of options for any design project. In summary, Fastrun is a must-have for any designer looking to add an edgy and dynamic touch to their designs. 8. Anglestein Anglestein, Image credit: Envato Elements ANGLESTEIN is a fantastic font that draws inspiration from retro car and amplifier emblems, making it the perfect choice for anyone looking to add a touch of vintage flair to their race-related designs. The font features all caps, along with multilingual support, alternate signs, numbers, and punctuation, which offer an excellent degree of versatility. We particularly loved how well ANGLESTEIN worked for band wordmarks, album covers, video titles, stickers, clothing designs, t-shirt designs, badges designs, banners, and flyers. Our experience with ANGLESTEIN was fantastic, and we couldn’t recommend it enough. In summary, ANGLESTEIN is one of the most exceptional and best racing fonts that offers a unique and authentic touch to any design project. So, whether you’re a graphic designer, marketer, or racing enthusiast, let ANGLESTEIN be your go-to font for creating memorable and evocative designs that stand the test of time. 9. Kasumi Font Kasumi Font, Image Credit: Envato Elements Kasumi is the perfect blend of retro and modern styles. As professional creatives, we loved using this font for a recent project. Its sleek old-school look and versatile uppercase multilingual letters, numbers, and punctuation allowed us to incorporate it into various designs effortlessly. We didn’t like that it may not be suitable for more traditional or formal designs. However, you can try an alternative font, QUICKSTARTER , for more formal designs. We highly recommend Kasumi for any project requiring a vintage flair with a modern twist. This font will surely add a unique and nostalgic touch to your work. 10. Formatting Script Formatting Script, Image credit: Envato Elements Looking for a font that can add retro style to your designs? Check out Formatting Script ! As professional creatives, we absolutely love this font for its unique style and ease of use. With 2 styles – script and extrude – it gives a very interesting shadow effect and includes OpenType features like ligature and alternate. It’s great for logos, posters, packaging, social media & greeting cards. We’ve personally used Formatting Script and found it easy to work with, delivering stunning results. On the other hand, it may not be suitable for those looking for a more modern look. We highly recommend Formatting Script as one of the best racing fonts for adding a retro touch to your designs! 11. Vintage Trainitty Script Vintage Trainitty Script, Image Credit: Envato Elements If you want to add a vintage touch to your designs, look no further than Trainitty . We’ve had the pleasure of using this font in several projects, and we have to say that we love it. Its vintage script style adds an authentic feel to any design, making it perfect for logos, packaging, and labels. We found this font to be one of the best racing fonts since it is incredibly versatile and suitable for various businesses, including clothing lines, motorbikes, cars, workshops, and garages. We didn’t appreciate that some of the characters were a bit ornate. However, we still recommend Trainitty for its unique style, versatility, and ease of use. You may also try your hands on the Pin to avoid ornate characters. 12. Refault Refault Font, Image credit: Envato Elements Refault Sports Game Sans Serif Display Font is a versatile and dynamic font that’s perfect for any design project. We’ve been delighted with this font and have used it extensively for various projects such as logo branding, editorial design, and modern advertising design. We love its sleek and modern design that exudes a sporty and dynamic vibe, and the wide range of weights and styles available allows for more creativity and flexibility in our designs. What we didn’t like was that some of the thinner weights may not be as legible in smaller sizes. Overall, we highly recommend giving Refault a try to elevate your designs to the next level. 13. Birosic Birosic, Image credit: Envato Elements Looking for a font that screams athleticism, speed, and power? Look no further than Birosic. As professional creatives, we can confidently say that this font is a game-changer. Its wide italic typefaces, modern cuts, and powerful slant make it perfect for fast vehicle racing sports titles, cycling, automotive game emblems, and running matches among other things. We loved the font’s ability to convey a sense of energy and athleticism, making it perfect for any sports-related project. However, what we didn’t like was its unsuitability for more formal or traditional designs and you may try an alternative font in the form of Distance. Birosic is certainly a font that will undoubtedly make your projects stand out from the rest. 14. PACAR FONT Pacar, Image Credit: CreativeMarket As professional creatives, we’re excited to share our experience using the PACAR FONT. This typeface is a game-changer, offering a unique and modern look that elevates any design project. The font’s versatility makes it perfect for branding, packaging, website design, and social media graphics. The clean lines and stylish curves make it a pleasure to use, and we especially love the way it looks in larger sizes. While we did not like that some of the thinner characters can be a bit difficult to read at smaller sizes, this minor drawback doesn’t significantly impact our overall impression of the font and you can use Grunge Tire Font to overcome these drawbacks. Highly recommended for designers of all skill levels. 15. Fast Track FastTrack, Image credit: Creative Market Looking for a font that exudes speed and power? Look no further than Fast Track! Our experience using Fast Track has been amazing, and we particularly like its versatility. We were positively impressed with this all-caps font for its distinct vintage racing style that’s perfect for automotive t-shirts, garage signs, and more. While it’s great for racing-themed designs, it also works well in other contexts. In short, if you want a font that screams speed and movement, Fast Track is an excellent choice. 16. Rush Driver Racing Rush Driver Racing, Image credit: Envato Elements RushDriver is a bold and dynamic display font designed to capture the essence of speed and motion. Each character features sleek slashes inspired by fast car brands, making it perfect for designs that embrace a fast-forward mentality. This bold font is ideal for creative businesses, sports branding, e-sports, gaming, automotive logos, posters, movies, advertising, motorcycles, and futuristic digital concepts. RushDriver includes alternate characters, ligatures, and multilingual support, offering versatility for a wide range of design applications. Available in OTF and TTF file formats, this font ensures compatibility and ease of use across various platforms. With its striking design, RushDriver guarantees your message stands out with power and speed. 17. Sakana Sakana Font, Image credit: Envato Elements As professional creatives, we were impressed with the bold and modern design of Sakana Font. This sport-inspired display typeface combines clean lines and dynamic style, making it a perfect fit for attention-grabbing projects. Its versatility allowed us to create impactful designs that clients appreciated. We found the inclusion of uppercase and lowercase characters, multilingual support, numbers, punctuation, and ligatures particularly helpful in achieving diverse design goals. Overall, we highly recommend Sakana Font for creatives seeking a modern, sporty typeface to elevate their work. One concern was that the bold style could feel overpowering in more subtle applications. To address this, pairing it with a complementary font can help balance the design. 18. Revv Revv, Image credit: DesignCuts Looking for a racing font that will make your motocross or motorsports branding stand out? Look no further than Revv. As professional creatives, we love this font for its unique blend of modern design and classic racing style. With an expanded character set, regular and oblique variations, and a sharp number set, Revv is perfect for creating eye-catching decals, logos, print projects, headlines, apps, and more. Trust us, Revv will leave your competition in the dust. 19. Srikandy Script Srikandy Scripts, Image credit: DesignCuts As professional creatives, we absolutely love using the Srikandy script! This bold and straightforward font comes in three types, with the special version offering unique small slices for added personal touch. Srikandy script is perfect for creating custom logos, wedding invitations, signage, and more. It supports multiple languages and has many OpenType features like binder, alternative style, contextual alternative, swash, etc. We found it easy to work with and highly customizable, making it suitable for a range of design projects. The only thing we didn’t like was that some features require professional design software. Overall, we highly recommend the Srikandy script for its versatility and unique features. 20. Black Butcher Black Butcher, Image credit: DesignCuts Looking for a font that perfectly embodies strength and boldness? Look no further than Black Butcher. As professional creatives, we absolutely love this font for its unique and personalized touch, making it stand out from the rest. The tiny slices and two types, regular and special, add versatility and flexibility to any project. Its features such as multilingual, stylistic alternates, contextual alternates, and swashes make it easy to customize and create a truly unique look for your design. In summary, if you want a font that captures the spirit of racing and adds a personal touch to your designs, Black Butcher is a top-notch choice! 21. Difficult Race Difficult Race, Image credit: Envato Elements Difficult Race is a beautiful racing font available in a stunning style. It looks strong and provides several ways to design your project. This font is perfect for construction, sports, racing logos, branding projects, and many more. Racing Hard is available in TTF and OTF file formats. Whether you’re designing a racing-themed website or crafting promotional materials for a motorsport event, this font is one of the best choices available. Its captivating visual impact is sure to leave a lasting impression on your audience, whether you’re unleashing your creativity on custom merchandise or any other design project. 22. Defgo Racing Defgo, Image credit: Envato Elements Defgo Racing is an all-caps, bold font that can be used for various modern design concepts. It gives an authentic look to the design. You can use this font effortlessly because it is available in OTF and TTF file formats. It is suitable for T-shirt printing, logos, eSport, etc. The bold and striking characteristics of Defgo Racing make it particularly suitable for designs that demand attention and make a lasting impression. Its strong presence and attention-grabbing style ensure that your message or brand identity stands out from the crowd, leaving an impact on your target audience. 23. Fasterz – Racing Display Font Fasterz, Image credit: Envato Elements Fasterz is a modern and energetic display font. It has a sense of speed and power and gives a unique feel to the design. It is suitable for various design concepts such as racing posters, news headlines, banners, stationery, flyers, book titles, etc. The eye-catching letterforms of this display font help you create designs with a special feel. It comes in four file formats – OTF, TTF, WOFF, and WOFF2. Therefore, you can use this font for different design concepts with ease. 24. Torque Craver – Fast Racing Font Torque Craver, Image credit: Envato Elements Just like the name, Torque Craver has a fast and energetic feel. It gives you an opportunity to add feelings of speed and power to your artwork. Torque Craver has been inspired by fast car branding and futuristic digital concepts. The bold style of this font adds a strong statement to the design. It is suitable for posters, sporty branding, eSport, gaming, motorcycles, digital futuristic concepts, automotive events, etc. Torque Craver is a perfect choice for representing the fast-moving forward mindset. 25. Drag Racing Drag Racing. Image credit: Envato Elements Drag Racing is a sport display font that you can use for racing sports and automotive-related designs. It has multilingual support and includes many alternatives and ligatures. The package also contains uppercase & lowercase letters, numbers, symbols, and punctuation. Drag Racing is suitable for logos, branding, posters, advertising, headlines, packaging, and more. It is available in TTF, OTF, WOFF, and WOFF2 file formats. 26. Fast Racer – Racing Display Font Fast Racer, Image credit: Envato Elements Fast Racer is a unique racing font that can be used for various projects related to sports and the automotive sector. It is available in TTF, OTF, and WOFF file formats enabling you to use this font in various designs. Fast Racer font is suitable for logos, packaging, branding, advertising, posters, etc. Its bold and dynamic letterforms enhance the message by evoking a sense of adrenaline, effectively communicating the thrill and excitement associated with sports and racing, thus making it on our list of the best racing fonts. 27. Start Race Typeface Start Race, Image Credit: Envato Elements Start Race is a sporty racing-inspired display typeface with strong and bold letters. It is perfect for sport-themed designs and adds a sense of speed to the artwork. It is ideal for logo designs, racing event titles, car stickers, etc. A benefit of using this font is it has an italic and a stencil version as well. So, you can use different styles of this font to make your designs memorable. You can easily access all features of this font without a design program because of PUA Unicode support. Apart from that, Start Race is versatile and comes in OTF, TTF, and WOFF2 file formats. The beautiful swashes of this speedy racing font can be accessed in design programs like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Corel Draw, etc. 28. Nightrace Night Race, Image credit: Envato Elements Nightrace is a race-theme display font inspired by a minimalist logo. It has a handmade touch and adds elegance to the design. This racing font is suitable for brochures, advertising, logos, branding, designing templates, book covers, logotypes, headers, etc. Nightrace has an authentic sports vibe and has the potential to elevate your creative artwork. It includes standard glyphs, web fonts, and multilingual accents to let you create various designs. 29. Fast Track – Racing Game Font Fast Track, Image credit: Envato Elements Fast Track is a gaming racing font that evokes the essence of speed and power into the artwork. The letters of this font have sharp corners and a solid shape to infuse the feelings of racing into your designs. This font is perfect for online games, movie titles, magazines, fast food menus, YouTube thumbnails, and many more. It includes capital and small letters, numbers, and punctuation. What we find enjoyable about this racing font is that it is very accessible. You can access this font in Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, and Microsoft Word. 30. Race Speedy Font Race Speedy Font, Image Credit: Envato Elements Race Speedy is a modern and bold font that gives an authentic look to your designs. It is perfect f or branding projects such as logos, eSports, T-shirt printing, and other designs.  Race Speedy comes in TTF and OTF file formats. Whether you’re designing a logo for a racing team, an eSports event, or a sports-related brand, Race Speedy font adds a distinct and professional touch. Its versatility allows you to create a visual identity that resonates with the target audience, evoking the excitement and adrenaline of speed and competition. 31. Lastlap Racing Font Lastlap Racing Font, Image credits: DesignCuts Lastlap is an amazing racing font perfect for any design related to racing themes. This dramatic, bold style font adds a feel of bravery to the artwork. It is ideal for logos, titles, headlines, book covers, banners, and more. Also, you can use this font for various other design concepts depending on your needs. It has multilingual support and comes with PUA-encoded characters. 32. Overdrive – Elite Automotive Font Overdrive, Image credit: DesignCuts Overdrive is an elegant automotive font inspired by Italian racing and the automobile industry. This font has a minimalist and stylish appearance to suit a variety of designs such as logos, posters, branding projects, social media, etc. This simple-looking font will help you create attractive and memorable designs that convey your message effectively. 33. Hard Race Racing Font Hard Race Racing Font, Image credit: CreativeMarket Hard Race is an energetic racing theme font with a strong and stern feel. This font looks fast and energetic and is suitable for designs like sports events, automotive, racing game covers, branding designs, product designs, and other creative projects. It includes standard glyphs, numbers, symbols, and multilingual support. This font can also be accessed in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and Microsoft Word. Hard Race is fully accessible without additional design software because of PUA-encoded characters. 34. Headline Speed Font Headline Speed Font, Image credit: CreativeMarket Headline Speed font is a bold and powerful font that brings uniqueness to any design. It is ideal for sports events, automotive posters, logos, monograms, etc. This font is easy to read and provides appealing visuals to the artwork. Speed font is available in OTF file format and includes uppercase letters, numbers, ligatures, and basic punctuation. 35. Swipe Race Swipe Race, Image credit: CreativeMarket Swipe Race is a modern racing font with slightly tilted letters and sharp lines. It provides a sporty look to the artwork. It is suitable for logos, branding, magazine covers, racing game covers, labels, product design, and many more. This font is available in TTF, OTF, and web font formats to suit different design needs. It includes standard glyphs and can be accessed in different design programs like Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, and Microsoft Word. 36. Fast Racing Fast Racing, Image credit: Envato Elements A hand-crafted typeface with a natural style and a dark color gradient is used especially to advertise racing events, design posters, banners, and flyers, make strong headlines, and endorse sports products and other projects. Fast Racing, an all-caps font with a multilingual approach is available in all sizes. This handmade design gives your work an earthy rough look. 37. Stormlight Storm Light, Image credit: Envato Elements Stormlight is dark shaded display especially made for sports projects. The sharp and edgy curves elevate the boldness of the text. The spark of lightning and thunder gives a natural stormy look to your digital work. This typeface is a great choice for sports/racing invites, cards, logotypes, web designs, headlines, product packaging, cover pages, or any design work. A handcrafted sports font with easy installation and standard glyphs works on both PC and Mac. The PUA-encoded characters along with accessibility to Adobe software require no additional design software. StormLight’s multilingual support increases the usage of the font in several different languages. 38. Skylarr Scott Skylar Scott, Image credit: Envato Elements A handmade brushy font Skylarr Scott is a rough-styled typeface. This hand-painted script unleashes the raw side of your project. The color contrast of mainly yellow, black, and red makes a stylish outline for your work. It contains a set of features that include ligature, standard glyphs, a web font, and work mode on both PC and Mac. These features are perfect for designing logos, posters, invitation cards, packaging, and letterhead. It can be used in various languages as it has multilingual support. The PUA-encoded font and accessible Adobe software make things much easier for a graphic designer or professional. Skylar Scott is available in both OTF and TTF formats. 39. Fire Ace Fire Ace, Image credit: Envato Element Here we have Fire Ace , which, as the name suggests, is an incredible display with a hot flame outlook. The hot red and orange colors add spicy flavor. Those burning flames on a curvy text enhance the fiery effect of your work. This blazing font will go well to give a fiery touch to spice and food brands, adding a burnout effect to invites for car racing and gaming events. The red hot burning small caps font contains multilingual support, numeric, an uppercase letter, symbols ligature, and alternates. You can download it in OTF, TTF, WOFF & WOFF2 files. 40. Driver Driver, Image credit: CreativeMarket Driver is a hand-crafted vintage script known for its realistic yet authentic hand-drawn effect. The font reflects the 60s and 70s comics image. The lively painted shades and scripted text with round curves of letters give a light and beachy look to your illustration. This retrospective versatile font comprises 5 styles including Regular, Halftone, Comics, Comics Halftone, and Handwritten. You can apply it to make cover pages of magazines and books, clothing, logos, product marketing, flyers, and posters. 41. Racers Energy Racers Energy, Image credit: DesignCuts Are you someone who wants to energize his digital content instantly? If so, then Racers Energy Font is for you and will surely put vibrancy into your work. Racer Energy is created with a race theme and uppercase letters that produce strong content. Blocky capital letters with sharp edges rejuvenate your work. The numeric, punctuation, and multilingual support of this typeface is a great option to illustrate logos, banners, merchandise, book covers, headers, social media posts, and printed products. Its multilingual approach supports languages such as English, Ethiopic, Romanian, Southeast Asia, Turkish, and Western Europe. Best Racing Fonts Summary Choosing the best racing font requires considering the brand and intended message. The font should be easy to read and stand out among other designs. Modern and sleek or classic and traditional, the font must reflect the brand’s personality and values while resonating with the intended audience. With numerous options available, selecting the right font is crucial for a successful design. Taking time to explore and experiment with different options can make a significant impact. Ultimately, the best racing font is the one that best represents the brand’s identity and appeals to the intended audience. We hope our article helps you find one such font (or fonts!) that conforms to your creative needs and appeases you and your audience. Until then, keep designing, everyone! Best Car Logos Best Tech Fonts Best Powerful Fonts
html:
Are you looking for the best racing fonts? Buckle up, as we share our top picks below.

Racing fonts play a crucial role in automotive design and branding. From car logos to advertising campaigns, the right font can communicate the essence of a brand or model.

Choosing the perfect font can be a daunting task, but we’ve got you covered with our list of the best racing fonts available today.

We’ve included a range of options, from classic and elegant to modern and bold, so you can find the perfect fit for your project.

Whether you’re designing a racing logo, creating a futuristic design, or simply want to add a touch of automotive flair, these fonts will take your work to the next level.

Our list includes both free and paid options, so you can choose based on your budget and needs – whether for commercial projects or personal use. We’ve thoroughly reviewed and tested each font, considering factors like readability, style, and versatility.

With the right car racing font, you can evoke a particular vehicle or brand’s speed, power, and personality. So strap in and get ready to explore our top picks for the best racing fonts out there.

Also see our compilation of the best car logos, best adventure Fonts, and best aggressive fonts.

UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Racing Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

41+ Best Racing Fonts for High Speed Designs

1. TORQUE MASTER

TORQUE MASTER is the ultimate font choice for adding a burst of racing energy to any design project.

As professional creatives, we’re huge fans of the strong, sharp corners and the cutout on the inner, along with the bold italic uppercase and regular lowercase letters that create the perfect balance.

We’ve personally used TORQUE MASTER for online games, posters, social media covers, and more, and it never fails to impress.

While it may not be suited for all design needs, if you’re looking to emphasize a high-energy theme, TORQUE MASTER is our perfect choice for you. We highly recommend this font for an extra boost to any design project.

2. Speed Demon

Speed Demon is the font that every designer needs to capture the essence of car racing.

As professional creatives, we’re in love with its sleek, modern design that perfectly conveys the boldness and power of the sport.

With sharp angles and dynamic lines, it’s ideal for any high-impact design that requires attention-grabbing typography.

We’ve used Speed Demon for various projects, from posters for racing events to marketing materials for sports brands, and it always delivers a sense of excitement and urgency.

Its versatility and adaptability make it easy to read at any size, and its racing-inspired style adds the perfect touch of speed and thrill.

Overall, we highly recommend Speed Demon for anyone looking to make a bold statement with their designs.

3. MONOCOQUE Car Racing Game Font

Looking to add some racing spirit to your designs? MONOCOQUE is the perfect choice! Its blocky shape, sharp corners, and cut-out interior motifs add a powerful and strong edge to any project.

As professional creatives , we’ve used MONOCOQUE in various projects like online games, movie titles, fast food menus, and social media page covers.

We were thoroughly impressed by its unique style and ability to catch the viewer’s eye.

Whether you’re a designer or marketer, MONOCOQUE’s bold design is sure to make your projects stand out from the crowd.

Though it is one of the best racing fonts, it can also be used by brands promoting a high-performance product.

It’s definitely worth considering for anyone looking to add some edge to their designs!

4. Chasis7

For us graphic designers, we can confidently say that Chasis7 is a font designed with automotive enthusiasts in mind.

Its sharp, angular lines and high-tech feel convey speed, power, and precision, making it the perfect choice for racing games and posters for car shows.

We love how it instantly captures attention and transforms designs into dynamic visuals.

However, we found that MONOCOQUE may not be suitable for more formal or conservative projects, and its bold design could potentially overwhelm certain presentations.

But if you’re looking for an alternative font that conveys a similar feeling of speed and power but with a more versatile and classic look, you might want to check out Piston Race .

Overall, we suggest this as one of the best racing fonts to create eye-catching designs related to the world of racing. Chasis7 is worth checking out.

5. Stooges Races

Stooges Races is a fantastic typeface that transports your designs back in time. As professional creatives, we love its hand-drawn style, which draws inspiration from vintage motorcycle posters from the early 1900s.

It’s perfect for logos, games, and graphics related to racing, automotive, Detroit, and classic machines.

We’ve used Stooges Races in our designs, and they always add a unique and retro charm that captures the essence of the era.

It’s the perfect choice for designing in the 1940s, 1950s, or 1960s, and adds a perfect touch of vintage flair to any project.

Overall, we highly recommend Stooges Races for anyone looking to add a touch of old-school character to their designs. Get ready to stand out with this fantastic typeface!

6. Dingbat Car Transport Provider

We had the pleasure of trying out the Dingbat Car Transport Provider font , and we must say, we were impressed!

This versatile font contains 62 symbols that are perfect for various projects, logos, and ornaments.

We loved how easy it was to use, with TTF, OTF, and EOT file formats, as well as Unicode compatibility.

We found the basic Latin characters clear and easy to read, making this font a great addition to any designer’s toolbox.

Overall, we highly recommend the Simple Car Service dingbat font for anyone looking for a unique and useful design element.

7. Fastrun

Fastrun is a font that exudes strength and power. We were absolutely delighted by this font for its bold and authentic display, making it the perfect choice for car racing-related designs.

We were impressed by the font’s versatility, which allows it to be used in nearly any design that requires strong characters.

Our experience with Fastrun was fantastic, and we enjoyed the availability of alternate characters, ligatures, and multilingual support, making it to our list of best racing fonts.

What we didn’t like is the font’s bold and strong character a bit overpowering for certain design projects that require a more subtle and delicate touch. To compensate for that, you may try Custody Script.

The regular, italic, italic outline, and outline versions offer a wide range of options for any design project.

In summary, Fastrun is a must-have for any designer looking to add an edgy and dynamic touch to their designs.

8. Anglestein

ANGLESTEIN is a fantastic font that draws inspiration from retro car and amplifier emblems, making it the perfect choice for anyone looking to add a touch of vintage flair to their race-related designs.

We particularly loved how well ANGLESTEIN worked for band wordmarks, album covers, video titles, stickers, clothing designs, t-shirt designs, badges designs, banners, and flyers.

Our experience with ANGLESTEIN was fantastic, and we couldn’t recommend it enough.

In summary, ANGLESTEIN is one of the most exceptional and best racing fonts that offers a unique and authentic touch to any design project.

So, whether you’re a graphic designer, marketer, or racing enthusiast, let ANGLESTEIN be your go-to font for creating memorable and evocative designs that stand the test of time.

We didn’t like that it may not be suitable for more traditional or formal designs. However, you can try an alternative font, QUICKSTARTER , for more formal designs.

We highly recommend Kasumi for any project requiring a vintage flair with a modern twist. This font will surely add a unique and nostalgic touch to your work.

10. Formatting Script

We’ve personally used Formatting Script and found it easy to work with, delivering stunning results. On the other hand, it may not be suitable for those looking for a more modern look.

Stormlight is dark shaded display especially made for sports projects. The sharp and edgy curves elevate the boldness of the text. The spark of lightning and thunder gives a natural stormy look to your digital work.

These features are perfect for designing logos, posters, invitation cards, packaging, and letterhead.

39. Fire Ace

Here we have Fire Ace , which, as the name suggests, is an incredible display with a hot flame outlook. The hot red and orange colors add spicy flavor. Those burning flames on a curvy text enhance the fiery effect of your work.

Its multilingual approach supports languages such as English, Ethiopic, Romanian, Southeast Asia, Turkish, and Western Europe.

Best Racing Fonts Summary

Choosing the best racing font requires considering the brand and intended message. The font should be easy to read and stand out among other designs.

Modern and sleek or classic and traditional, the font must reflect the brand’s personality and values while resonating with the intended audience.

With numerous options available, selecting the right font is crucial for a successful design. Taking time to explore and experiment with different options can make a significant impact.

Ultimately, the best racing font is the one that best represents the brand’s identity and appeals to the intended audience.

We hope our article helps you find one such font (or fonts!) that conforms to your creative needs and appeases you and your audience. Until then, keep designing, everyone!
